DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Protocol Agent Randomization Fractions ISO21090.REAL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are A number representing the quantity of study subjects in the overall study who receive at least one study agent (as opposed to placebo) divided by the quantity of subjects in the study overall - independent of dosage or other protocol variations. NOTE(S): This value can be thought of as the percentage of study subjects who will be exposed to the study agent(s), though it is expressed as a real number with a maximum value of 1.0.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Protocol Agent Randomization Fractions
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:A part, a fragment of a whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:A part, a fragment of a whole.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.
A part, a fragment of a whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
